sentences.sContent: She would think him churlish if he refused.
sentences.sCn: 如果他拒绝，她会觉得他不礼貌。

sentences.sContent: The room was so nice it seemed churlish to argue.
sentences.sCn: 这房间这么好，吵架的话就显得无礼了。

synos.tran: 没有礼貌的；脾气暴躁的

remMethod.val: 脾气太坏 (churlish)， 得去教堂 (church) 忏悔

words.tran: 吝啬鬼；乡下人；粗暴的人；（中世纪的）农民

trans.tranCn: 没有礼貌的；脾气暴躁的
trans.tranOther: Someone who is churlish is unfriendly, bad-tempered, or impolite
